sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: PublicSquare shares drop more than 20% as it announces $7.5M registered direct offering
feed.summary: PublicSquare's shares plummeted over 20% after the company announced a $7.5 million registered direct offering. This offering includes the sale of nearly 5.86 million shares at $1.28 per share, a discount to its recent closing price. The company expects to use the proceeds for general working capital, product development, marketing campaigns, and potential acquisitions.

feed.title: PSQ Holdings Announces Registered Direct Offering and Warrants
feed.summary: PSQ Holdings (PSQH) recently closed a registered direct offering for approximately $7.5 million, involving Class A common stock, pre-funded warrants, and common warrants. This capital infusion is intended for working capital and general corporate purposes, though it includes short-term restrictions on further equity issuance and insider sales. Analysts currently rate PSQH as a Hold with a $1.00 price target, while TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, assigns a Neutral rating due to financial instability despite strategic fintech expansion.

feed.title: PSQ Holdings to raise $7.5 million through share offering at $1.10
feed.summary: PSQ Holdings, Inc. (NYSE:PSQH) announced a definitive agreement to sell 6,818,184 shares of Class A common stock and accompanying warrants to an institutional investor at $1.10 per unit, aiming to raise $7.5 million. The offering includes warrants for an additional 8,522,730 shares exercisable at $1.18. The company plans to use the proceeds for general corporate purposes and is undergoing a strategic shift towards becoming a "fintech-forward business."

feed.title: PSQH - PSQ Holdings Latest Stock News & Market Updates
feed.summary: This page provides the latest news and updates for PSQ Holdings (Ticker: PSQH), focusing on corporate developments, financial performance, and strategic initiatives. Recent news highlights include a $7.5 million registered direct offering, significant year-over-year GMV growth for payments during Black Friday/Cyber Monday, and the launch of "PSQ Impact" for fundraising. The platform also details partnerships and acquisitions aimed at expanding its fintech ecosystem and market presence.

feed.title: PSQ Holdings announces registered direct offering and warrants
feed.summary: PSQ Holdings has announced a registered direct offering for gross proceeds of approximately $12 million. The offering includes 5,420,000 shares of its common stock at a purchase price of $2.20 per share, along with unregistered warrants to purchase an aggregate of 5,420,000 shares of common stock. The company plans to use the net proceeds for working capital and general corporate purposes.

feed.title: PSQ Holdings reports surging holiday GMV and credit growth
feed.summary: PSQ Holdings (PSQH) reported a significant surge in preliminary Gross Merchandise Volume (GMV) and credit growth during the 2025 Black Friday through Cyber Monday period. GMV processed by PSQ Payments increased by 536% year-over-year, reaching $7.8 million, while Credova's financed volume and contracts also saw substantial growth. Despite a "Hold" rating from analysts and a "Neutral" assessment from TipRanks' AI Analyst due to financial performance concerns, the company highlights these figures as evidence of accelerating adoption and scalability of its services.

feed.title: PSQ Holdings to raise $7.5 million through share offering at $1.10
feed.summary: PSQ Holdings (NYSE:PSQH) has announced a definitive agreement to sell 6,818,184 shares of Class A common stock and accompanying warrants to an existing institutional investor at $1.10 per combined unit, aiming to raise approximately $7.5 million. The company plans to use the net proceeds for general corporate purposes, including working capital, as it pursues a strategic shift towards becoming a "fintech-forward business." This offering follows a significant 536% increase in payment volume during the 2025 Black Friday through Cyber Monday period for its PSQ Payments business.

feed.title: PSQ Holdings (NYSE: PSQH) reports major GMV growth for 2025 Black Friday
feed.summary: PSQ Holdings reported significant Gross Merchandise Volume (GMV) growth for its PSQ Payments and Credova credit businesses during the 2025 Black Friday through Cyber Monday period. PSQ Payments GMV surged by 536% to $7.8 million, while Credova GMV increased by 75% to $1.238 million, accompanied by a 73% rise in loan and lease contracts. The company cautioned that these preliminary, unaudited metrics are indicators of platform activity and not revenue, and may be subject to adjustment.

feed.title: PSQ Holdings to raise $7.5 million through share offering at $1.10
feed.summary: PSQ Holdings, operating as PublicSquare, announced a definitive agreement to sell 6,818,184 shares of Class A common stock and accompanying warrants at $1.10 per combined unit to an existing institutional investor, aiming to raise approximately $7.5 million in gross proceeds. This offering facilitates PSQ Holdings' strategic shift towards becoming a "fintech-forward business" and will be used for general corporate purposes, including working capital. The company also recently saw a 536% increase in payment volume during the 2025 Black Friday through Cyber Monday period and engaged in several strategic business developments.

feed.title: PublicSquare Announces $7.5 Million Registered Direct Offering
feed.summary: PublicSquare (NYSE: PSQH) announced a registered direct offering with an existing institutional investor for 6,818,184 shares of its Class A common stock (or pre-funded warrants) and accompanying warrants to purchase up to 8,522,730 shares. The offering is expected to generate approximately $7.5 million in gross proceeds, to be used for general corporate purposes, including working capital. Roth Capital Partners is acting as the exclusive placement agent.

feed.title: PSQ Holdings Terminates Asset Purchase Agreement
feed.summary: PSQ Holdings (PSQH) terminated its Asset Purchase Agreement with Tandym, Inc. on December 9, 2025, because Tandym failed to complete the sale of loan receivables by the deadline. No termination fees were incurred. Currently, analysts rate PSQH as a Hold, with a price target of $1.50, while TipRanks’ AI Analyst, Spark, also rates PSQH as Neutral due to its poor financial performance despite positive strategic initiatives.

feed.title: PublicSquare (NYSE: PSQH) to acquire Tandym assets, adds private-label cards for merchants
feed.summary: PublicSquare (NYSE: PSQH) announced its agreement to acquire key software assets from Tandym, Inc., aiming to enhance its fintech ecosystem by adding virtual and private label credit cards. This acquisition is expected to empower merchants within the PublicSquare network to launch branded payment and credit card programs, reduce processing fees, and increase customer loyalty and retention. The deal, anticipated to close in December 2025, also projects improved gross margins and a path toward adjusted EBITDA breakeven for PublicSquare.

feed.title: Hebert, PSQ Holdings CPO, sells shares for $36k, buys for $15k
feed.summary: Michael Robert Hebert, Chief People Officer of PSQ Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:PSQH), sold 23,310 shares for a total of $36,130 on November 13, 2025, and subsequently purchased 9,400 shares for $15,102 on November 14. These transactions, which included a sale to cover taxes, resulted in an increase of his total holdings to 252,876 shares. PSQ Holdings also reported a significant 37% year-over-year revenue increase in Q3 2025 and announced an acquisition of software assets from Tandym, Inc. to enhance its fintech offerings.

feed.title: PSQ Holdings CEO Seifert sells shares worth $19,765
feed.summary: PSQ Holdings (NASDAQ: PSQH) CEO Michael Stephen Seifert sold 12,752 shares of Class A Common Stock for $19,765 to cover taxes related to stock unit settlements. The shares were sold at a weighted average price of $1.55, and Seifert now directly owns 126,812 shares and indirectly holds 102,475 shares through a spouse. This sale follows strong Q3 2025 financial results for PSQ Holdings, which included a 37% revenue increase and an upcoming acquisition of software assets from Tandym, Inc.

feed.title: Insider Selling: PSQ (NYSE:PSQH) Insider Sells 23,310 Shares of Stock
feed.summary: PSQ Holdings (NYSE:PSQH) insider Michael Robert Hebert sold 23,310 shares of the company's stock on November 13th, valued at $36,130.50. This sale reduced his holding by 8.86%, though he subsequently acquired 9,400 shares on November 14th. The company's stock traded down 5.4% the following Monday, hitting $1.50, after reporting a quarterly EPS miss, despite analysts maintaining a "Moderate Buy" rating with an average target price of $5.17.

feed.title: PublicSquare Delivers Strong Third Quarter Financial Results & Beats Revenue Guidance by 10%
feed.summary: PublicSquare (NYSE: PSQH) announced strong Q3 2025 financial results, beating revenue guidance by 10% and reaffirming Q4 2025 and full-year 2026 revenue guidance. The company saw significant growth in its fintech segments, with Fintech revenue up 28%, Credit revenue up 22%, and Payments revenue up 50% quarter over quarter. PublicSquare plans to expand its fintech platform in 2026 with new services like private-label credit cards and crypto payment capabilities, while monetizing its Brands and Marketplace segments.

feed.title: PSQ Holdings Announces Executive Team Changes
feed.summary: PSQ Holdings (PSQH) announced executive team changes on November 12, 2025, confirming officers and individuals subject to Section 16 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934. As a result, Andrew Weisbecker, President of Marketplace, is no longer an executive officer. Spark, TipRanks’ AI Analyst, rates PSQH as Neutral due to weak financial performance, declining revenues, and high leverage, despite some positive insights from the earnings call.

feed.title: PSQ Holdings Acquires Tandym Assets for Fintech Growth
feed.summary: PSQ Holdings (PSQH) is acquiring assets from Tandym, Inc. to enable merchants to offer private label credit and debit cards, a deal valued at up to $6.75 million, expected to close in December 2025. This acquisition aims to enhance PublicSquare’s fintech ecosystem, introduce new revenue streams through merchant-branded credit programs, and drive sustainable profitability. Despite the strategic move, TipRanks’ AI Analyst, Spark, rates PSQH as a Neutral due to weak financial performance, declining revenues, and high leverage.

feed.title: PublicSquare to Acquire Assets of Tandym, Adding Virtual & Private Label Credit Cards to its Growing Fintech Ecosystem
feed.summary: PublicSquare (NYSE: PSQH) announced its agreement to acquire key software assets from Tandym, a company providing white-labeled payments and credit solutions for consumer brands. This acquisition aims to strengthen PublicSquare's fintech ecosystem by enabling merchants to launch branded payment and credit card programs, reduce processing fees, and enhance customer loyalty through a closed-loop payments environment. The deal is expected to close in December 2025, significantly advancing PublicSquare's strategic evolution into a full-stack fintech platform.

feed.title: PublicSquare to Acquire Assets of Tandym, Adding Virtual & Private Label Credit Cards to its Growing Fintech Ecosystem
feed.summary: PublicSquare (NYSE: PSQH) announced its agreement to acquire key software assets from Tandym, Inc. This acquisition aims to strengthen PublicSquare's fintech ecosystem by adding virtual and private label credit card capabilities, enhancing recurring revenue, and deepening merchant and consumer retention through integrated payments, credit, and rewards programs. The deal is expected to close in December 2025 and will allow merchants in PublicSquare's network to launch branded card programs, reduce processing fees, and improve customer loyalty and lifetime value.

feed.title: Priority To Go Private? and other Digital Transactions News briefs from 11/10/25
feed.summary: Priority Technology Holdings Inc. is considering a take-private proposal from an investor group led by its chairman and CEO, Thomas Priore. Other digital transactions news includes PSQ Holdings acquiring software assets from Tandym Inc., Paystand Inc. acquiring Bitwage Inc., and Experian PLC introducing a new credit score. Bakkt Inc. also reported increased revenue due to stronger crypto-market activity.

feed.title: PSQ Holdings Enters Negotiations to Acquire Tandym Assets
feed.summary: PSQ Holdings (PSQH) is in negotiations to acquire intellectual property assets from Tandym, Inc. for $5.75 million in stock and up to $1.0 million in cash. The company reported a 37% increase in Q3 2025 net revenue and improved its net loss by 33% year-to-date, reaffirming its revenue guidance for Q4 2025 and full year 2026. Analysts currently rate PSQH as a Buy with a $3.50 price target, though TipRanks' AI Analyst Spark assesses it as Neutral due to ongoing financial challenges despite strategic growth initiatives.

feed.title: Major 2A Industry Partnership: PublicSquare Brings Fintech to Nation's Top Suppressor Distributor
feed.summary: PublicSquare's fintech segment has partnered with Silencer Shop, the largest distributor of suppressors in the U.S., to provide innovative payment and credit solutions to the firearms industry. This collaboration aims to offer robust, reliable, and values-aligned financial services, addressing an industry often underserved by traditional financial providers. Both companies are committed to supporting Second Amendment-supporting businesses against financial discrimination and fostering their growth.

feed.title: PublicSquare Announces the Closing of $36.2 Million Registered Direct Offering of Common Stock
feed.summary: PublicSquare (NYSE: PSQH) has successfully closed a registered direct offering, generating approximately $36.2 million in gross proceeds from the sale of 7,813,931 shares of its Class A common stock at $4.63 per share. The company intends to use these net proceeds for general corporate purposes, including working capital. Roth Capital Partners acted as the exclusive placement agent for the offering.

feed.title: PublicSquare Announces $36.2 Million Registered Direct Offering of Common Stock
feed.summary: PublicSquare announced a registered direct offering of 7,813,931 shares of its Class A common stock at $4.63 per share, totaling approximately $36.2 million in gross proceeds. The offering is expected to close around December 5, 2024, with Roth Capital Partners acting as the exclusive placement agent. PublicSquare intends to use the net proceeds for general corporate purposes, including working capital.

feed.title: PSQH Stock (PSQ Holdings) Soars 270% Following Donald Trump Jr.'s Joining
feed.summary: Shares of PSQ Holdings (PSQH) surged 270.4% after Donald Trump Jr. announced he was joining the company's board. PublicSquare, the parent company, focuses on a "cancel-proof" economy and operates an online marketplace aligned with conservative values. Trump Jr. has also recently joined the boards of Unusual Machines and 1789 Capital, and is an Executive Vice President at The Trump Organization.

feed.title: PublicSquare Formally Launches Payments Platform
feed.summary: PublicSquare has formally launched its payments platform and implemented a strategic plan to streamline its organization, resulting in a 35% reduction in staff. The company also announced a $5.35 million PIPE investment to fund growth in its payments vertical and aims to reach $1.0 billion in annualized payments processing Gross Merchandise Value (GMV) by the Christmas shopping season. PublicSquare is also modifying its marketplace to align with fintech goals, curating merchants, and plans to launch an affiliate fee-based offering in 2025.

feed.title: SHAREHOLDER ALERT: Pomerantz Law Firm Investigates Claims on Behalf of Investors of PSQ Holdings, Inc. - PSQH
feed.summary: Pomerantz LLP is investigating potential securities fraud claims against PSQ Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: PSQH) following its disclosure of a classification error in its unaudited condensed consolidated statements of cash flows. The error, which involved misclassifying cash outflows related to transaction costs, led PSQ to state that its financial statements should no longer be relied upon. This announcement caused PSQ's stock price to fall by 3.72%.
